unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of research into how students learn science concepts.
Implement teaching strategies for using ICT that engage students in their learning.
Demonstrate knowledge of the content of Stages 4 and 5 science of the current NSW 7-10 syllabus and impending NSW syllabus for the Australian Curriculum.
Demonstrate understanding of a range of teaching strategies related to the content of Stages 4 and 5 of the science syllabuses.
Plan and implement effective science lessons that provide achievable challenges for students of varying backgrounds and abilities.
Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of strategies for differentiating teaching to meet specific learning needs of students across a range of backgrounds and abilities.
Explore educational ideas through action research.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Pre-reading and completing tasks via iLearn

assessments.description: The aim of this assignment is to provide you with the opportunity to develop research skills for diagnosing and solving problems in the classroom (1600-2000 words)

The aim of the assignment is to give you the opportunity to develop your expertise in inquiry-based, student-centred science teaching by using this approach in one lesson of your choice and engaging in reflection on this lesson. 
(1600-2000 words).
